title: Tickets for Lionesses' friendly against Germany at Wembley sell out
text:
That was the biggest ever turn-out for a women's fixture in this country

The attendance looks set to exceed the 80,023 crowd during Olympics in 2012

Tickets for the Lionesses' friendly against Germany at Wembley on 9 November have sold out, the FA have confirmed.

The attendance looks set to exceed the 80,023 crowd that watched the USA beat Japan 2-1 during the 2012 Olympic Games - the biggest ever turn-out for a women's game in this country.

Former England captain and Manchester United manager Casey Stoney admitted it was a milestone she never imagined women's football could reach.

'It's a dream come true. I played for Chelsea's first team from the age 12 so I've been involved in the game at the top level for 25 years. I didn't ever, ever think we would see the day,'

'Let's hope the performance matches the occasion and that everyone wants to come back.'
description: The attendance looks set to exceed the 80,023 crowd that watched the USA beat Japan 2-1 during the 2012 Olympic Games - the biggest ever turn-out for a women's game in this country.
